trans-unit.source: Provides a collection of font families built from font files that are provided by the client application.
The PrivateFontCollection class allows applications to install a private version of an existing font without the requirement to replace the system version of the font.
For example, [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdiplus](~/add/includes/ndptecgdiplus-md.md)] can create a private version of the Arial font in addition to the Arial font that the system uses.
PrivateFontCollection can also be used to install fonts that do not exist in the operating system.
This is a temporary font install that does not affect the system-installed collection.
To see the installed collection, use the <xref:System.Drawing.Text.InstalledFontCollection> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Text.PrivateFontCollection"></xref> class.
Adds a font from the specified file to this <xref href="System.Drawing.Text.PrivateFontCollection"></xref>.
Windows Forms applications support TrueType fonts and have limited support for OpenType fonts.
If you try to use a font that is not supported, such as an unsupported OpenType font or a Bitmap font, an exception will occur.
The AddFontFile is not supported on operating systems before [!INCLUDE[Win2kFamily](~/add/includes/win2kfamily-md.md)].
When using a private font on operating systems before [!INCLUDE[Win2kFamily](~/add/includes/win2kfamily-md.md)], the default font, typically Microsoft Sans Serif, will be substituted.
A <xref:System.String> that contains the file name of the font to add.
The specified font is not supported or the font file cannot be found.
Adds a font contained in system memory to this <xref href="System.Drawing.Text.PrivateFontCollection"></xref>.
To use the memory font, text on a control must be rendered with GDI+.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.SetCompatibleTextRenderingDefault%2A> method, passing `true`, to set GDI+ rendering on the application, or on individual controls by setting the control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox.UseCompatibleTextRendering%2A> property to `true`.
Some controls cannot be rendered with GDI+.
The memory address of the font to add.
The memory length of the font to add.
To be added.
